channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report X-2023110616
item.description:
Report X-2023110616

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: OTTUMWA
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading the box was found to be wet, authorized personnel were notified and the package and all other possibly damaged packages were taken to QA for further proccessing DescribePack: A cap on one of the jugs came loose causing the contents to leak out DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was put into a tote and taken to QA for further processing

item.title: Report X-2023110605
item.description:
Report X-2023110605

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It was discovered on Unload that it was leaking. It was taken by QA to the Hazmat cage in a red tote. DescribePack: The plastic must have deteriorated around the closure (where the lid is). DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spill outside the box was minimal so it was cleaned according to the MSDS.

item.title: Report X-2023101242
item.description:
Report X-2023101242

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-15
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CN RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10-15-2023 a CN transportation employee observed liquid dripping from the bottom outlet valve cap during routing work operations at the CN Waterloo Yard in Waterloo, IA. The employee notified the Yard Supervisor who then initiated an emergency response from the CN Dangerous Goods Team. The BOV handle was cycled several times from the closed to open position to ensure there was no foreign material trapped in the valve seat that would prevent a proper seal. The cap was then removed and the valve was monitored for 10 minutes for any continued leakage. There was no longer any leakage from the valve at this point. An inspection of the BOV cap gasket was performed and revealed it to be very stiff allowing the product to leak past the gasket. The BOV gasket was replaced and the cap re-installed utilizing a 24" pipe wrench. Car was released back to CN transportation department for continued transportation to destination.

item.title: Report E-2023110472
item.description:
Report E-2023110472

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: SIOUX CITY
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 cups of Methyl Ethyl Ketone Solution (UN1193) were released from (1) carton with (12) 1-liter plastic bottles due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. The SDS with the terminal and it was determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (1) 5-gallon DF contains cardboard with (12) 1-gallon plastic bottles was created as waste and left for the terminal to manage.
